commentary: Shamsi to Samson, 1 run, South Africa win by 9 runs, Shamsi dragged the length back, Samson comes down the pitch and chips the drive to long-on for a single
Shamsi to Samson, FOUR, drilled, tossed up on off, Samson comes down the pitch, gets close to the ball and then hammers the drive back past the non-striker, runs away to the ropes
Shamsi to Samson, no run, no, he can't - two legal deliveries will do it for Shamsi and SA - flighted delivery on middle and Samson can't get under it, drags the sweep past square leg

Shamsi to Samson, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries for Samson. flighted delivery on off, he gets a good stride forward and then clobbers it back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes. This is turning out to be one excellent knock from Samson, can he finish it off?
Shamsi to Samson, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Samson, pressure on and Shamsi drops it short - Samson rocks back and thumps the pull past square leg, one bounce and over the ropes
Shamsi to Samson, SIX, hammered, Samson is keeping the chase alive - dropped short by Shamsi, Samson rocked back and hammered the pull over mid-wicket, went sailing over into the stands for a maximum
Shamsi to Samson, wide, Shamsi drops one short and well down leg, called as a wide
Rabada to Ravi Bishnoi, FOUR, streaky and four, on a good length and well wide of off, Bishnoi swings hard and toe-edges it past the keeper, runs away to the ropes in a hurry

Rabada to Ravi Bishnoi, no ball, another swing, another miscue and another catch for Bavuma at cover. Bishnoi backing away and swinging, gets it low on the bat and as he was walking away, the siren rang, signalling that Rabada had overstepped. He will get a free-hit now

Rabada to Avesh Khan, out Caught by Bavuma!! South Africa are closing the match in some style - hard length from Rabada, Avesh backed away on the slog, hit low on the bat and it's a steepler for Bavuma, he watches it all along, went reverse cupped and held on. Avesh Khan c Bavuma b Rabada 3(6)
Rabada to Avesh Khan, no run, short of a good length and well outside off, Avesh swings hard and misses once again

Rabada to Avesh Khan, 2 runs, a chance, a big effort from Ngidi, but he spills it as he landed - fuller length delivery outside off, Avesh backed away on the drive, sliced it high and over backward point, Ngidi backpedalled, kept his eyes on the ball and nearly pulled it off
Rabada to Avesh Khan, no run, fuller length delivery and holding its line outside off, Avesh swings across the line and missed
Rabada to Avesh Khan, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Avesh backs away on the swing and missed
Ngidi to Samson, no run, Ngidi shortens the length outside off, has Samson poking on the steer and beat him on the outside edge
Ngidi to Samson, wide, short and wide of off, Samson throws his bat on the cut and missed, called as a wide
Ngidi to Avesh Khan, 1 run, short of a length and at the stumps, Avesh hops across and tucks it towards square leg

Ngidi to Kuldeep Yadav, out Caught by Bavuma!! A back-pedalling Bavuma holds onto a screamer and India are losing their way now. Was another slower ball from Ngidi - Kuldeep was early into the lofted drive, chipped it lamely and over extra-cover, Bavuma ran back, kept his eyes on the ball and completed a tumbling catch. Landed on his left shoulder and winced, but hasn't caused any damage onto himself. Kuldeep Yadav c Bavuma b Ngidi 0(1)

Ngidi to Thakur, out Caught by Maharaj!! That's the wicket South Africa were after - Shardul is livid with himself, was right in the slot, but he didn't get the placement on the drive, hit hard and to the left of mid-off where Maharaj moved across and cusped it neatly. Was pitched up and Shardul went hard on the drive, skewed it slightly and that cost him his wicket. Thakur c Maharaj b Ngidi 33(31) [4s-5]
Ngidi to Samson, 1 run, much betgter from Ngidi, bowls intgo the pitch and hits Samson high on the bat, off the inner half and bounces to long-on

Ngidi to Samson, FOUR, handy boundary for Samson, was almost undone by the slower full-toss which dipped on him, but so does he and manages to wrist it away behind square on the on-side, beat short fine and raced away to the ropes. Good start to the over for India
Ngidi to Samson, wide, .. and he starts with a wide, was looking for the slower cutter, but he pushed it well past the tramlines

Rabada to Thakur, FOUR, 14 from the over, back of a length and well wide of off, Shardul stands tall and plays a forehand slap, back over the bowler's head and went almost all the way, bounced right in front of the ropes
Rabada to Thakur, FOUR, cheeky and four, on a good length and at the stumps, Shardul shuffles across, uses the pace on the ball and then laps it over short fine, bounces away to the ropes
Rabada to Thakur, no run, slower short ball outside off, Shardul hops across and only manages a slap straight to extra-cover
Rabada to Samson, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, no room to free his arms and Samson punches it wide of cover for a single
Rabada to Thakur, 1 run, on a good length and well wide of off, clattered away square on the off-side for a single
Rabada to Thakur, FOUR, .. that's a good start to the over, slower short ball from Rabada, but it's way too short and it's slapped straight of mid-off, bounces away to the ropes
Shamsi to Samson, FOUR, 14 off the over, dragged short by Shamsi - Samson rocks back and pummels the pull past square leg, struck with immense power, one bounce and over the ropes

Shamsi to Samson, FOUR, much needed boundary for Samson and India, came down the pitch, didn't get to the pitch and ended  up dragging it wide of mid-wicket, but he's struck well enough to bisects the two fielders who convereged across in the deep
Shamsi to Samson, 2 runs, flighted delivery around middle and leg, worked in front of square on the on-side and Samson hares back for the second
Shamsi to Thakur, 1 run, very full from Shamsi, Shardul was looking to launch it back over the bowler's head, drags a big inside edge to long-on for a single
Shamsi to Samson, 1 run, flighted delivery on the leg-stump line, flicked past square leg for a single
Shamsi to Samson, 2 runs, tossed up and drfting onto the pads, nudged in front of square on the on-side and Samson comes scampering back for the second, raises his 2nd ODI fifty
Ngidi to Thakur, no run, on a good length and just outside off, driven firmly and straight to the fielder at extra-cover, despite that 6, only 8 came off the over
Ngidi to Samson, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, Samson steers it down towards third man for a single

Ngidi to Samson, SIX, cracking shot, tad too short from Ngidi - Samson swivels across and connects the pull sweetly, made a loud noise as it went sailing over the deep mid-wicket boundary. India need many more of these
Ngidi to Samson, no run, fuller length delivery on off, Samson leans forward and finds mid-on with the drive

Ngidi to Samson, no run, that's cut Samson in half, on a good length and shaping back into the right-hander, bowled with a scrambled seam, nips back in late and burst past Samson's inside edge, didn't miss the off-stump by much
Ngidi to Thakur, 1 run, on a good length and well wide of off, Shardul drags the heave through mid-wicket for a single
Maharaj to Thakur, 1 run, tossed up on off, Shardul makes room and pushes it in front of backward point for a single
Maharaj to Thakur, no run, pushed through around off, Shardul backs away and finds cover with the cut
Maharaj to Samson, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, worked in front of square on the on-side for a single
Maharaj to Thakur, 1 run, dropped short and spinning away from the right-hander, Shardul is in no control over the cut, chips it uppishly and through mid-off
Maharaj to Samson, 1 run, flighted around middle and leg, Samson stays deep in the crease and works it through mid-wicket
Maharaj to Thakur, 1 run, loopy delivery on off, eased down to long-off for a single
Parnell to Thakur, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, Shardul chips the drive wide of cover for a single
Parnell to Samson, 1 run, Parnell shortens the length and angles one back into the right-hander, dabbed down to third man for a single
Parnell to Samson, FOUR, cheeky and four, back of a length anbd just outside off, Samson lets the bakll come, opens the face of the bat and then runs it past the keeper, fine and into the ropes
Parnell to Samson, no run, short of a good length and well wide of off, Samson went chasing and chops an under-edge on the cut to backward point
Parnell to Samson, FOUR, clubbed, effortless from Parnell, spotted the length early, rocked back and pulled this short ball over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes
Parnell to Samson, no run, on a good length and angling back into the right-hander, defended to the off-side
Shamsi to Samson, 1 run, dropped short by Shamsi, Samson is overeager on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that bounces short of deep mid-wicket

Shamsi to Samson, no run, this looked a lot closer, Shamsi screams an appeal and is turned down - they can't review either. Nicely tossed up and spinning back into the right-hander - Samson pressed his front-foot across and then tried to work it to the on-side, missed and was struck in front of off. Was it straightening? Need to check another replay. The impact is umpire's call, so Samson got a big enough stride to save himself

Shamsi to Thakur, 1 run, tossed up around off, Shardul presses his front-foot forward on the slog, drags a big inside edge and umpire Anil Kumar Chaudhary has to be quick to move out of the way at square leg
Shamsi to Samson, 1 run, Samson gets lucky, came down the pitch and swung across the line - beaten in the flight and he's lucky to have managed an inside edge, else de Kock would have been in play
Shamsi to Thakur, 1 run, nicely tossed up on off, Shardul gets close to the ball and drives it down to long-on for a single
Shamsi to Samson, 1 run, flighted delivery on the leg-stump line, nudged towards square leg for a single
Shamsi to Samson, wide, Shamsi slides one well down leg, called as a wide
Parnell to Thakur, no run, Parnell shortens the length outside off, punched off the back-foot to backward point
Parnell to Thakur, no run, short of a length and angling back into the right-hander, has Shardul hopping and strikes him high on the thigh-pad
Parnell to Samson, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, dabbed down towards third man for a single
Parnell to Samson, no run, short and wide of off, Samson threw his hands on the cut and missed
Parnell to Thakur, leg byes, 1 run, half-an-appeal for LBW, but Shardul was struck high on the thigh-pad, was the nip-backer and he was beaten on the inside edge
Parnell to Samson, 1 run, back of a length and angling across the right-hander, Samson runs it down towards third man for a single

Shamsi to Thakur, no run, loud loud shout for LBW - Shamsi was screaming and pleading, and he once again convinces Bavuma to review, I'm afraid this looks like a copy of the first review - no bat and UltraEdge confirms it. Onto ball-tracking: The impact is in line and it's spinning down leg - South Africa have burned both reviews. Nicely tossed up and spinning back into the right-hander, Shardul got a bigger stride forward and was beaten on the inside edge. But once again the impact is in front of leg and would've been sliding down
Shamsi to Samson, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, Samson tucks it past mid-wicket for a single

Shamsi to Samson, FOUR, beautifully played, a little shimmy down the pitch, Samson made room and then drove it it to the left of mid-off. Parnell moved across and then dived over the ball, took some pace off, but it still rolls away to the ropes
Shamsi to Samson, no run, flighted delivery on off, Samson gets close to the ball and finds mid-off with the drive
Shamsi to Samson, 3 wides, wrong line from Shamsi, pitched outside leg and spun down sharply, no chance for de Kock and the ball is stopped near the ropes, two bonus runs for India
Shamsi to Thakur, 1 run, dropped short and just outside off, punched square past cover for a single

Shamsi to Thakur, no run, loud shout for LBW, but this could be turning down leg. Shamsi was adamant though and South Africa will review. Think this is doing too much, no bat and UltraEdge confirms it. Onto ball-tracking: The impact in line and it's spinning down leg, the review is lost. Big turn for Shamsi, past Shardul's inside edge as he pressed forward, but the impact was only in front of leg
Rabada to Thakur, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, punched off the back-foot to deep cover
Rabada to Thakur, no run, back of a length and just outside off, cut straight to the fielder at backward point
Rabada to Thakur, no run, the slower ball bouncer from Rabada, Shardul was way too early on the pull and missed, bounced on its way to the keeper
Rabada to Samson, 1 run, back of a length and well wide of off, Samson runs it down towards third man for a single
Rabada to Thakur, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off - Shardul rides the bounce and cuts it in front of cover for a single
Rabada to Samson, 1 run, pace off the delivery from Rabada - Samson had to reach out on the hack and drags an inside edge past mid-wicket
Rabada to Samson, no ball, short of a good length and angling across the right-hander, Samson was poking away from his body and gets an inside edge past the off-stump. But Rabada has overstepped
Shamsi to Thakur, no run, the wrong 'un from Shamsi, Shardul goes right back and then chops it to backward point, wanted a single and is sent back
Shamsi to Samson, leg byes, 1 run, Shamsi drifts one down leg, Samson was looking to flick and missed, brushed the pad on its way to short fine
Shamsi to Samson, 2 runs, Shamsi has been way too short - Samson swivels across and pulls it past square leg, a sliding save near the ropes and he's back for the second
Shamsi to Thakur, 1 run, tossed up around off, Shardul prods forward and skews an inside edge, behind square on the on-side for a single
Shamsi to Thakur, FOUR, that had the square leg umpire ducking for cover, a rank half-tracker, dropped half-way short and Shardul swivels across and hammers the pull over square leg
Shamsi to Samson, 1 run, flighted delivery on the leg-stump line, punched down to long-on for a single
Ngidi to Thakur, FOUR, that's easy runs for Shardul, tad too straight from Ngidi, Shardul shuffles across, gets inside the line and flicks it fine, runs away to the long leg boundary
Ngidi to Thakur, no run, short of a good length and wide of off, Shardul throws his bat out on the drive and missed

Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Rabada!! There's the wicket and most probably the game. Ngidi kept hitting the deck hard and the line was also tight. Iyer just couldn't get it away and he perishes trying to play the big shot. This was a short of length delivery and Iyer is deceived by the extra bounce, the pull comes off the higher part of the bat and the ball lobs to mid-on, simple catch to Rabada. Shreyas Iyer c Rabada b Ngidi 50(37) [4s-8]

Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, two dots and Iyer has a wild hack. Ngidi has his hands on his head. Short of length, Iyer swings across the line and is beaten on the outside edge. The length and bounce did not allow him to make the connection
Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, 136.5ks delivery close to off-stump, Iyer angles it with an open bat face to backward point
Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, back of a length around off, Iyer pats it with soft hands in front of backward point

Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fifty for Iyer. A counterattacking knock and one that India needed badly. He's keeping India in the hunt though the asking rate is close to 10. Flighted delivery around off, Iyer eases a drive down to long-off
Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, no run, tossed up on off, Iyer leans forward and blocks it to the leg-side
Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, neatly done! Iyer waited for the ball to arrive and played it really late, almost dabbed it off de Kock's gloves, he gets it wide of slip and the ball races away
Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, no run, flighted on middle and leg, Iyer prods forward and defends it back
Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, no run, short and turning big, Iyer was shaping to cut but aborts from the shot, even de Kock has a hard time gloving that
Maharaj to Samson, 1 run, flatter and quicker around off, Samson opens the bat face and knocks it square on the off-side

Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, hit the deck delivery and bit of extra bounce, Iyer gets on top and steers it behind square on the off-side, Shamsi is the one near third man and the pair scamper back easily
Ngidi to Samson, 1 run, short of length close to off, Samson pats it with soft hands to the right of de Kock and Iyer calls him through
Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, 137.4ks back of a length delivery and Iyer punches it to sweeper cover
Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, short and into the body, Iyer swivels and pulls in front of square, he calls for two and gets it comfortably
Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, 136.4ks back of a length around off, Iyer drops it in front of point and wants a single, sent back
Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, 137.3ks fullish delivery and Iyer turns it off the inner half to mid-wicket
Maharaj to Samson, no run, maiden! Samson was happy to play Maharaj out. Sliding on with the arm and he misses the tuck, struck high on the pad around leg
Maharaj to Samson, no run, slower and spinning away, Samson waits in the crease and directs it to point
Maharaj to Samson, no run, attacks the stumps, Samson stays rooted to the crease and defends it with a straight bat
Maharaj to Samson, no run, this one turns and keeps low, Samson toe-ends the cut back to Maharaj
Maharaj to Samson, no run, spin and bounce. Starts around off-stump and spins away, Samson lets it pass
Maharaj to Samson, no run, flighted but skids on after pitching, Samson brings his bat down and keeps it out
Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, short of length around off, Iyer opens the bat face and punches it past backward point, two more

Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's a gimme from Ngidi and Iyer does not miss out. Half volley on the pads and Iyer picks it nonchalantly with a superb flick shot, sends it flat and on the bounce over deep square leg
Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, 131.3ks back of a length around off, Iyer punches it back to Ngidi and is livid with himself

Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, not off the middle but good enough for Iyer. Short and wide outside off, he does not hold back on the cut and throws everything, the top-edge flies fine and beats third man comfortably
Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, 136.2ks hit the deck ball around off, Iyer punches it off the inner half to mid-on
Ngidi to Samson, 1 run, 135.7ks back of a length delivery and Samson dabs it down to third man
Parnell to Samson, 1 run, shuffles across and tucks the back of a length delivery to deep square leg
Parnell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short and bowled into the wicket, Iyer pulls sans timing through mid-wicket and has to settle with a single
Parnell to Samson, 1 run, fraction short and outside off, Samson back cuts and Ngidi is brought squarer, just a single
Parnell to Samson, no run, 131.9ks fullish delivery outside off, Samson pushes it confidently to cover

Parnell to Samson, no run, short and into the wicket, angled in and Samson is cramped for room, he attempts the cut shot and is beaten on the outside edge. Bit of extra bounce as well and that didn't help
Parnell to Samson, 2 runs, short of length around off, Samson opens the bat face and steers it to third man, needed a sliding stop from Ngidi and the pair are back for the second

Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries and for the first time in India's innings the crowd are enjoying themselves. Shamsi drags the length short this ball, Iyer waits on the back foot and punches it in front of square, well away from the deep point fielder

Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, back to back boundaries. This time Iyer uses his feet, gets to the pitch of the flighted delivery and lofts it with the spin over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, this time off the middle and gets it where he wanted. Iyer sits down and sweeps it backward of square leg. Ngidi was at square leg but he could not get across to make the stop

Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, brilliant stop by Bavuma. Iyer goes for the big sweep shot and drags it off the under-edge to the left of leg slip, Bavuma dives across and makes the save. Iyer quickly gets back into his crease
Shamsi to Samson, 1 run, flatter and drifted across, Samson opens the bat face and directs it square of the wicket
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fraction short and Iyer mistimes the pull in front of square on the leg-side, just a single
Parnell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, on a length and outside off, Iyer drives on the rise and straight to sweeper cover

Parnell to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, streaky! Another inside edge and this time it wasn't far from the off-stump. Angled outside off and Iyer aims to drive but ends up playing away from the body, the edge missed the off-pole by a whisker and beat a diving de Kock
Parnell to Samson, 1 run, fullish delivery outside off, Samson eases the drive to the left of mid-off and crosses over
Parnell to Samson, wide, overdoes it this time and angles it too far outside off, Samson ignores and umpire signals a wide
Parnell to Samson, no run, full and slanted outside off, teasing Samson and he shoulders arms

Parnell to Samson, no run, short of length and bit more bounce, Samson wanted to steer it to third man but chops it onto his body and the ball rolls into the off-side. That could have so easily been chop on no. 3

Parnell to Shreyas Iyer, 3 runs, short and angled across the right hander, Iyer slaps it in front of square past cover and it needed a desperate dive near the rope from Miller to stop the boundary, saved a run

Shamsi to Samson, SIX, fabulous shot! Samson uses his feet and gets close to the flighted delivery, then hits it with the spin over mid-wicket and the timing ensures that the ball travels the distance. In fact, replays show it was the googly but Samson got really close to the ball and that allowed him to loft against the turn
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, overpitched outside off, Iyer drives in front of square and it is only a single
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, jumps out and tries to heave it across the line, gets it off the toe-end onto the pad and the ball drops safely on the leg-side
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, wide, flighted near leg-stump and turns further down, Iyer happy to let it pass and collect the wide
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, quicker and flatter immediately, Iyer punches it past cover and scampers back for the second

Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, overcooks the flighted delivery and Iyer is quick to pounce, he takes a couple of steps down and slams it straight back over the bowler. Not off the middle but good enough to trickle away
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, wide, spinning down leg and Iyer has no chance connecting with the flick, wide given
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, tossed up around off, Iyer triggers forward and back before knocking it to Shamsi

Maharaj to Samson, no run, Samson was quick to challenge the decision and that's because he knew there was a bit of wood. Flatter delivery and sliding in with the arm, Samson is caught in the crease and luckily brings his bat down, the inside edge saves him on this occasion
Maharaj to Samson, no run, fraction short and turning away, Samson hangs back and directs it to backward point

Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Janneman Malan!! Both set batters sent back in successive overs. The South African spinners are casting a web on this batting line-up. But credit to Bavuma for having a leg slip. Kishan comes down the track and is deceived in the air, he tries to fend it away but the ball spins in and takes the inside edge to leg slip, Malan hangs on to the dolly and India slip further. Ishan Kishan c Janneman Malan b Maharaj 20(37) [4s-3]

Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, hesitation but no harm done. Turns away big outside off and Iyer eases it towards cover, Bavuma dives and makes a half stop and that allows the pair to cross over comfortably
Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, no run, floated up and Iyer was thinking about the sweep, decides against it and ekes out an inside edge onto the pad
Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, comes down the track and whips it past Bavuma, but straight to deep mid-wicket
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, drifts it across the right hander, Iyer tries to ease it through the off-side and is beaten on the outside edge
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, tossed up on off, Iyer leans forward and works it to mid-wicket
Shamsi to Shreyas Iyer, wide, spinning big down leg and Iyer has no chance of playing that, wide called

Shamsi to Gaikwad, out Stumped!! Shamsi strikes in his first over. Gaikwad's resistance has finally come to an end. The pressure was telling and he had to go after Shamsi. Shimmies down the wicket and is defeated in the flight, the ball dips on him and spins past his swinging blade, de Kock was blinded by Gaikwad but gloves the ball cleanly and takes the bails off. Gaikwad st de Kock b Shamsi 19(42) [4s-1]
Shamsi to Gaikwad, no run, spinning in from good length, Gaikwad prods forward and ekes out an inside edge onto the pad

Shamsi to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, tossed up close to off, Kishan goes for the reverse sweep and the ball lobs off the glove over the slip fielder, Malan runs back and puts in the dive but can't get a hand to it
Shamsi to Gaikwad, 1 run, half tracker and Gaikwad misses out, pulls to wide long-on and it is only a single

Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, no run, comes down the track but does not get to the pitch of the ball, misses the flick and it lobs off the pad into the leg-side. Another tidy over from Maharaj (left-arm spinner) and he really has kept a lid on Kishan (left hander batter). Match ups anyone?
Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, no run, worked with the spin to mid-wicket

Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, no run, smart bowling from Maharaj. Kishan thought about stepping out but the length was dragged back and the ball spins in sharply, Kishan lunges forward and is hit on the glove as he tries to defend
Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, no run, flighted and spinning in, Kishan prods forward and blocks it back
Maharaj to Gaikwad, 1 run, short and turning away big, Gaikwad reaches and chops it square on the off-side
Maharaj to Gaikwad, no run, tossed up around off, Gaikwad presses forward and defends it back

Ngidi to Ishan Kishan, no run, direct hit and Gaikwad was gone. Kishan sold him down the river there. Good length ball around off, Kishan drops it with soft hands in front of cover and calls for a single, Gaikwad responds and is halfway down when he was sent back, Maharaj's throw is not on target at the bowler's end and Gaikwad survives
Ngidi to Ishan Kishan, no run, back of a length but with a bit of extra bounce, Kishan was hopping to tuck it into the leg-side but gets a soft leading edge back to Ngidi

Ngidi to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, now Kishan lays into Ngidi. Fraction short and there was width for Kishan to capitalize, he rolls his wrists nicely on top of the cut shot and places it square on the off-side - bisecting backward point and cover-point perfectly
Ngidi to Ishan Kishan, no run, 133.9ks good length ball on off, Kishan hangs back and bunts it to cover
Ngidi to Gaikwad, 1 run, angled in, Gaikwad takes a step down and flickcs it to deep mid-wicket
Ngidi to Gaikwad, FOUR, is that the release Gaikwad and India were looking for? Short and wide outside off, Gaikwad makes a bit of room and cuts it over backward point, one bounce and over the ropes
Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, no run, drifts it in with the angle, Kishan camps back and blocks it down the pitch
Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, no run, slides it across the left hander, Kishan tries the cheeky late cut and is beaten on the outside edge
Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, no run, flatter and turning in, Kishan sits back and knocks it to the left of Maharaj
Maharaj to Gaikwad, 1 run, drifts in with the arm, Gaikwad keeps his bat and pad close before stabbing it into the off-side

Maharaj to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, fraction short and Kishan goes for the pull, but the ball turns in and takes the toe-end over mid-wicket, bit of confusion between the pair and they don't get the second run

Kuldeep Yadav to Miller, no run, pushed it through and Miller is caught in the crease, settles with a block to cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Miller, 2 runs, tossed up around off, Miller reverse sweeps behind square on the off-side and scampers back for the second

Kuldeep Yadav to Miller, byes, 2 runs, ripper! That's an excellent riposte from Kuldeep. Quicker, drifts across and spins sharply, Miller is rooted to the crease and beaten neck and crop, Samson once again struggles to glove one cleanly. Two more extras
Kuldeep Yadav to Miller, FOUR, first ball against Kuldeep and Miller brings out the sweep, he fetches it from outside off and strikes in front of square to the vacant deep mid-wicket region
Ravi Bishnoi to Miller, 1 run, pushed through around off, Miller drops it into the off-side and crosses over

Ravi Bishnoi to Miller, FOUR, Miller is off and running. Half tracker from Bishnoi and Miller was not missing out, he quickly transfers his weight back and cracks the cut in front of square. No one at sweeper cover to stop that
Ravi Bishnoi to Miller, no run, googly drifted across and Miller angles it with an open bat face to backward point
Ravi Bishnoi to Miller, wide, strays down leg, Miller misses the tuck and Samson gets something on that
Ravi Bishnoi to Miller, no run, quicker, fuller and around off, Miller prods forward and eases it to the left of Bishnoi

Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, out Lbw!! That looked dead as soon as de Kock missed it but he still challenged the decision, South Africa lose the review. It is the reverse sweep that has brought about his downfall, Bishnoi pushed it through and dragged the length back as well, de Kock does not get anything and is struck right in front of the stumps. No doubt in umpire Anil Chaudhary's mind and India have got a massive wicket. de Kock lbw b Ravi Bishnoi 48(54) [4s-5]
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, leg byes, 2 runs, spinning in and de Kock misses the flick, the ball deflects off the pad and the pair settle with a brace
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, no run, slower and the length is dragged back, Klaasen is through the reverse sweep and misses, struck high and outside off-stump
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 1 run, very full delivery and de Kock tries to whip it into the leg-side, closes the bat face and the leading edge rolls to point
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, no run, flighted and bit of away turn, de Kock prods forward and blocks solidly
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, 1 run, dipping full toss and Klaasen somehow gets his bat down on the sweep, hits it along the ground to deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 1 run, now the conventional sweep and de Kock hits it straight to deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, no run, tossed up around off, de Kock reverse sweeps it straight to backward point
Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, unlucky! Another well-directed short ball and Klaasen once again was trying to evade taking his eyes off, the ball brushes the glove and flies over a leaping Samson

Siraj to Klaasen, no run, he's ducked straight into a bouncer. This time Siraj gets his radar spot on, aims for the batter and Klaasen takes his eyes off the short ball, gets hit on the shoulder and shows no sign of pain
Siraj to Klaasen, wide, short and into the wicket but the ball angles down leg, Klaasen gets inside the line and lets it pass, wide called
Siraj to de Kock, 1 run, leg-lined delivery at 133ks, de Kock tucks it to deep square leg
Siraj to de Kock, wide, slips the slower delivery down leg, de Kock misses the glance and Samson dives to his right to glove the ball
Siraj to Klaasen, 1 run, 135.1ks delivery angled in, Klaasen hops and clips it to deep square leg
Siraj to de Kock, 1 run, 130.4ks full delivery on off, de Kock pats it with soft hands in front of mid-on and quickly crosses over
Siraj to de Kock, FOUR, cheeky! de Kock knows there's no fine leg in place, so he moves across his stumps and laps the back of a length delivery to the vacant region
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, no run, floated up outside off, Klaasen drives and picks out mid-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, no run, drifted across the right hander, Klaasen goes for the reverse and misses, struck on the pad outside off-stump
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, no run, quicker and at the stumps, Klaasen hangs back and turns it to mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, FOUR, shot! This time the sweep works. Klaasen picks the chinaman and sweeps it with the spin to deep square leg, bisected the two fielders in the deep perfectly

Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, 2 runs, gift and Klaasen has missed out. Juicy full toss but Klaasen had premeditated the sweep and has to swipe it towards deep mid-wicket, Gaikwad gets around and keeps it to a brace
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 1 run, eased down to long-off
Avesh Khan to Klaasen, no run, full delivery shaping away outside off, Klaasen shoulders arms
Avesh Khan to Klaasen, FOUR, fullish delivery and Klaasen checked his on-drive, chips it past de Kock and luckily it is wide of Thakur at mid-on, once it passes the infield there's no stopping that
Avesh Khan to Klaasen, no run, 129.7ks good length ball outside off, Klaasen lifts his bat and lets it go
Avesh Khan to Klaasen, no run, 131.1ks full delivery at the stumps, Klaasen eases it gently to mid-on

Avesh Khan to Klaasen, no run, there's still enough assistance for the bowlers. Good length ball in the channel, Klaasen plays for the angle coming in and has a poke, the ball holds its line and beats the outside edge
Avesh Khan to Klaasen, wide, sprays the outswinger outside off and Klaasen ignores, easy call for the umpire
Avesh Khan to Klaasen, no run, 132.5ks good length ball around off, Klaasen camps back and defends to the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 2 runs, picks a very full delivery to play the reverse and de Kock manages to get it past a diving backward point, Gaikwad tidies up in the deep
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, 1 run, slower and drifted across, Klaasen reverse sweeps to deep backward point
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 1 run, flighted on off and middle, de Kock sits down and reverse sweeps to sweeper cover

Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, no run, uhhh! Kuldeep is hitting the right areas. Tossed up on off-stump and de Kock has to play, he prods forward to defend but the ball spins away and beats the outside edge

Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, 1 run, in the air and safe. Klaasen premeditates the paddle and the top-edge balloons over the keeper, Dhawan anticipates the shot and starts running back from slip but the ball evades him and lands safely
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 1 run, low dipping full toss and de Kock flicks to deep square leg, just a single
Thakur to Klaasen, no run, nips back in from a good length and Klaasen turns it off the inner half to mid-wicket
Thakur to de Kock, 1 run, back of a length close to off, de Kock drops it with soft hands in front of backward point and calls for a quick single
Thakur to Klaasen, 1 run, fuller in length and Klaasen drives sans footwork to mid-off, quickly crosses over
Thakur to Klaasen, no run, good length ball around off, Klaasen hangs back and jams it onto the pad
Thakur to Klaasen, no run, attacks the stumps, Klaasen is right behind the line to defend it down the pitch
Thakur to de Kock, 1 run, fraction short and around off, de Kock gives room and flays it behind square on the off-side, just a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Markram, out Bowled!! Whoa! That's another beauty to get rid of Markram. Kuldeep had him in a web from the first ball and it seemed only a matter of time before Markram was sent packing. This is a conventional chinaman, drifts across the right hander and spins back in sharply, Markram plunges forward to defend but the ball finds a gap between bat and pad, goes on to hit the top of off-stump and Kuldeep enjoyed that. The ball brushed the front pad but not enough to save Markram. Markram b Kuldeep Yadav 0(5)
Kuldeep Yadav to Markram, no run, sharp turn and plenty of it, Markram's making room and is lucky that the ball spun that much, he ekes out an inside edge onto the pad
Kuldeep Yadav to Markram, no run, quicker and drifted across, Markram is not picking him and somehow dabs it to backward point
Kuldeep Yadav to Markram, no run, uhhh! The wrong 'un and Markram had no clue. He's saved by the shortish length as the ball spins away and beats the outside edge

Kuldeep Yadav to Markram, no run, in the air and safe. Markram would have had his heart in his mouth. The ball spins in and is heading down leg, Markram closes the bat face to work it into the leg-side and the leading edge pops up, lands safely near silly mid-off
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 1 run, tossed up on off, de Kock nurdles it with soft hands backward of square and quickly crosses over

Thakur to Bavuma, out Bowled!! Jaffa! This is a peach from Thakur and Bavuma had no answer to that. The nip-backer from a fullish length and Bavuma is beaten by the exaggerated movement, he attempts a forward push away from the body and leaves a gap between bat and pad, the ball sneaks through to hit off and middle-stump. Bavuma's woes on this tour continue.. Bavuma b Thakur 8(12) [4s-2]
Thakur to de Kock, 1 run, short of length at the body, de Kock gets the pull high on the bat and the ball trickles to deep square leg

Thakur to de Kock, no run, uhhh! This one nips back in and cramps de Kock for room, he attempts the cut and is lucky not to have edged/chopped it onto the stumps. He has a wry smile and so does Thakur
Thakur to de Kock, no run, good length ball close to off, de Kock hangs back and bunts it down the pitch
Thakur to de Kock, no run, fuller and around off, de Kock leans forward and drives it to cover
Thakur to de Kock, FOUR, streaky! Good length ball angled across off, de Kock goes for the drives and plays outside the line, the inside edge flies past the stumps and races to fine leg

Ravi Bishnoi to Bavuma, FOUR, massive over, 16 runs. All the pressure built in the last few overs have been let go. Overcooks the flighted delivery outside off and Bavuma does not miss out, he opens the bat face and square drives it through point, giving sweeper cover no chance of stopping the ball
Ravi Bishnoi to Bavuma, no run, flatter and at the stumps, Bavuma is nicely behind the line and defends to mid-wicket

Ravi Bishnoi to Bavuma, wide, darted down leg and Bavuma misses out on the pull. Samson and Bishnoi appeal for a strangle but that was to try and put the umpire off. Bishnoi is struggling and Dhawan rightly walks up to have a word
Ravi Bishnoi to Bavuma, no run, fired it short and into the wicket, Bavuma tries to swing through the line and is defeated by the pace

Ravi Bishnoi to Bavuma, no ball, FOUR, off the mark with an audacious reverse sweep. It was the googly and Bavuma picked it from outside leg-stump and swept it square on the off-side. Bishnoi has overstepped
Ravi Bishnoi to Bavuma, no run, slower and around off, Bavuma prefers to stay back and keep it out to point
Ravi Bishnoi to Bavuma, no run, shortens the length on the leg-break, Bavuma hangs back and has a prod, the ball spins away and beats the outside edge
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, 1 run, leg-lined delivery and de Kock flicks it to deep mid-wicket

Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, 5 wides, bonus runs for South Africa. Poor from Bishnoi and Samson. Leg-break starts outside leg-stump and keeps going further down, no chance for de Kock but Samson should have done better, he moves to his right and gets a glove but not enough to stop the ball
Thakur to Bavuma, no run, a wicket-maiden for Shardul Thakur as Bavuma blunts the full delivery back down the pitch
Thakur to Bavuma, no run, good length just outside off at 132ks, tapped late to backward point
Thakur to Bavuma, no run, looks to cut a 130ks delivery on the hop and gets a thick inside edge that deflects onto his boot. Very lucky there is the South African skipper
Thakur to Bavuma, no run, full and angled in on the stumps at 132ks, solid forward block
Thakur to Bavuma, no run, 128ks good length on off, Bavuma is happy to block that with soft hands

Thakur to Janneman Malan, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! That drop catch doesn't cost much. Shardul Thakur is delighted. Sends in a full delivery at the pads and entices Janneman Malan into an aerial whip/flick. The ball seemed to have stopped a touch and it flies off the thick toe-end towards Iyer at mid-wicket. Catching practice. Janneman Malan c Shreyas Iyer b Thakur 22(42) [4s-3]

Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, no run, tries the reverse for the third time in the over and fails yet again, he was a little too early into the shot and missed it completely. Strikes him in  front of off and it's clearly missing off with the spin (googly)
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, 2 runs, full on the stumps, whipped away to the left of long-on
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, 2 runs, bowls it full just outside off, QDK stays low and paddles it fine past the keeper for an easy couple of runs
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, no run, attempts the reverse once again and gets beaten for pace outside off this time around
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, no run, picks the full delivery from leg stump and slams the reverse sweep straight to the fielder at short third
Ravi Bishnoi to Janneman Malan, 1 run, tossed full just outside off, pushed away square on the off-side for a quick single
Thakur to Janneman Malan, 1 run, 134ks sits up on a length wide of off, sweetly punched to deep cover
Thakur to Janneman Malan, no run, back of a length outside off, punched straight to cover
Thakur to Janneman Malan, no run, short of length outside off, Malan hops and punches to extra cover
Thakur to de Kock, 1 run, 130ks length delivery on the stumps, easy tuck away towards square leg
Thakur to Janneman Malan, 1 run, swivels and pulls the 131ks short ball down to fine leg
Thakur to Janneman Malan, no run, tries to flick a 134ks nip-backer and gets beaten on the inside edge, hit high on the front pad
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, no run, touch quicker around off-stump, QDK looks to work into the leg-side and gets hit on the splice
Ravi Bishnoi to Janneman Malan, 1 run, googly once again, a tad shorter and drifting into the pads as Malan pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, 1 run, drags the googly short and wide of off, QDK cuts it along the ground to sweeper cover
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, FOUR, loads it full and just outside off, QDK stays low and hammers the sweep behind square on the leg-side. Timed it really well and got the desired result
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, no run, quicker outside off, pushed into the covers
Ravi Bishnoi to de Kock, FOUR, cheeky from QDK! Picks the googly just outside off and plays the latest of cuts to get it past Dhawan's left at slip
Thakur to Janneman Malan, no run, short and wide of off at 130ks, Malan mistimes the cut (off the inside edge) to backward point
Thakur to Janneman Malan, no run, 132ks short of length outside off, left alone to the keeper
Thakur to de Kock, 1 run, looks to fend a 128ks short of length delivery and gets a thick inside edge that rolls to square leg
Thakur to Janneman Malan, 1 run, full outside off, driven away to deep cover

Thakur to Janneman Malan, no run, dropped! Thakur finds his length outside off and draws Malan into a loose poke, a thick outside edge and it carries comfortably towards Gill at slip who couldn't cling on. Straight in and straight out
Thakur to de Kock, 1 run, 127ks back of a length on the stumps, QDK drags the pull off the splice into the leg-side for a quick single
Avesh Khan to Janneman Malan, 2 runs, 128ks full outside off, Malan gets a thick inside edge on the push that races to the left of fine leg
Avesh Khan to Janneman Malan, no run, 128ks shaping away well outside off, Malan wants none of it - Left alone!
Avesh Khan to Janneman Malan, no run, goes fuller and wider of off, left alone to the keeper

Avesh Khan to Janneman Malan, FOUR, much-needed boundary for South Africa. You cannot be bowling short to the Proteas. Not when there isn't a great deal of bounce on the deck. 133ks angled into the body and Malan slams the pull square on the leg-side
Avesh Khan to Janneman Malan, no run, pitched up outside off at 130ks, Malan drives and finds extra cover
Avesh Khan to Janneman Malan, no run, 134ks inswinger on a length, Malan looks to play straight and gets a leading edge towards backward point
Siraj to de Kock, no run, woof! That's a peach from Siraj. 133ks hits the seam on a fullish length and cuts away sharply off the deck as QDK stares in disbelief on the back foot
Siraj to Janneman Malan, 1 run, 130ks good length on off, Malan shuffles down the track and works it wide of mid-on for a quick single
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, 130ks back of a length outside off, punched straight to cover
Siraj to Janneman Malan, wide, slower ball bumper that sails down the leg-side as Malan withdraws the pull, on the swivel, at the last moment
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, 132ks on a length outside off, Malan strides across and smothers it into the covers
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, pitched up outside off at 133ks, Malan drives and gets it off the toe-end towards mid-on
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, snakes back from a length at 132ks, Malan tries to knock into the leg-side and gets beaten on the inside edge. Hit high on the front pad
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, length delivery seeking off-stump, punched back to the left of the bowler
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, good length just outside off, QDK gets across and nudges to mid-wicket
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, 132ks pitched up just outside off, no feet from QDK and he gets an inside edge onto pad on the attempted drive
Avesh Khan to de Kock, 2 runs, hangs back and punches the length delivery in the gap between cover and backward point. Easy two
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, 133ks back of a length outside off, QDK punches crisply and finds backward point
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, 132ks good length on off, defended into the off-side

Siraj to Janneman Malan, FOUR, 131ks short ball with no venom, Malan swivels and powers the pull to the right of fine leg. Siraj isn't happy with the effort of the fielder? Or perhaps he isn't happy with himself for bowling that line?
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, 134ks short of length outside off, Malan plays the late dab to backward point
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, 132ks jags in sharply off the seam and Janneman Malan does well to cover his off-stump and shoulder arms
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, 133ks on a length outside off, left alone
Siraj to de Kock, 1 run, 133ks help-me on the pads, QDK is happy to flick it square on the leg-side for an easy single
Siraj to de Kock, no run, 134ks shaping away from the left-hander, hits the seam and moves a long way past the outside edge as QDK stares in surprise
Avesh Khan to Janneman Malan, no run, full and seams in at 133ks outside off, Malan opts for a booming drive and gets beaten on the outside edge
Avesh Khan to Janneman Malan, no run, wider lines, left alone to the keeper

Avesh Khan to Janneman Malan, no run, 132ks slanted in from wide of the crease, Malan walks across and gets beaten on the inside edge. He was looking to push on the off-side and deflected it to the slip cordon off the thigh pad
Avesh Khan to de Kock, 1 run, 133ks curling into the pads, easy clip away down to fine leg
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, zips off the deck from a length and beats QDK once again as he tries to fend from the crease
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, 134ks short of length angling away outside off, QDK looks to defend and gets beaten on the outside edge

Siraj to Janneman Malan, FOUR, signature Janneman Malan! He loves the punch through covers and does not put too much effort on the front foot. Just sits comfortably in the crease and times it sweetly in the gap on the off-side
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, squared him all ends up! Gets the length delivery to angle in and tail away ever so slightly to beat the shuffling push of Janneman Malan
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, 134ks shapes in and holds its line outside off, Malan is nearly drawn into a poke. Manages to play inside the line at the last possible instant
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, 131ks shortens the length and keeps it in the outside off corridor, Malan looks to push into the off-side and gets beaten on the outside edge
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, Siraj loads it further wide of off at 136ks, Malan is happy to leave that to the keeper
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, 129ks fuller and well wide of off-stump, Malan lunges across and shoulders arms
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, beauty! 138ks skids off the deck from a length and rips past the outside edge as QDK looks to poke into the off-side

Avesh Khan to de Kock, FOUR, stand and deliver! de Kock does not overcomplicate things. He sees a full ball in the outside off channel and the hands take over, driven crisply and beats mid-off to his left quite comfortably

Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, a huge grunt of "ahhhh" from Quinton de Kock as he gets hit on the inner thigh pad. Was squared up a tad as he tried to nudge a length delivery into the leg-side and got beaten by the late away movement
Avesh Khan to de Kock, 2 runs, misfield from Shreyas Iyer. 136ks pitched up outside off, QDK drives to the left of mid-off who fumbles on the dive and enables an easy second for the duo
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, 135ks full outside off, not a flowing drive from QDK and he's mistimed it straight to mid-off
Avesh Khan to de Kock, no run, 127ks curves back in from a length and beats QDK on the inside edge, a mild appeal for lbw but that's a little too high in line with middle and leg
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, good length angled in just outside off at 131ks, Malan shuffles and punches to cover
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, angles in and seams away from a fuller length, draws Malan onto the front foot and beats the outside edge
Siraj to Janneman Malan, 2 runs, goes a tad full outside off and Janneman Malan slices the drive behind square on the off-side for a couple of runs
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, good length on off, bunted down the pitch with soft hands

Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, wobbles in from a fullish length and holds its line around off, Malan was on the shuffle and played down the wrong line. He was looking to push it towards mid-on with a closed bat face and misses it completely, it strikes him below the knee roll in line with off which got Siraj and the others excited. Not a bad review that from India...
Siraj to Janneman Malan, no run, fuller and seaming in outside off, Janneman Malan is happy to shoulder arms

Nortje to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Iyer fittingly finishes things and it's 1-1! A classy square-drive to cap things off, was a wide half-volley and with the field up on the off-side, Iyer could pick his spot. He decided to get it through backward point
Nortje to Samson, 1 run, angling into the hips, Samson gets across and clips it away behind square leg
Nortje to Samson, no run, full and outside off, Samson punches it firmly to mid-off
Nortje to Samson, no run, back of a length around off, Samson gets on the back foot and defends

Nortje to Samson, FOUR, okay, Samson decides to give the T20 fans some finishing joy. Stays back and uses all of the pace on this shortish delivery with a delightful late dab. Tried it off Nortje's last over, was denied by some great fielding but third man can't do anything this time

Parnell to Samson, 1 run, well, they are actually doing this in singles. Sure the purists will love this, not the modern day folks. Fuller length ball, Samson gets a faint inside edge on the flick and this goes off the back pad towards short third man
Parnell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short and angling into the hips, Iyer whips it away behind square leg

Parnell to Samson, 1 run, slower ball, fuller, Samson gets forward and jabs this back towards Parnell who has a needless shy at the striker's end. Hits the stumps but Samson was well in. The batters get a single off the ricochet
Parnell to Samson, no run, angling in around middle and leg, Samson clips it gently to mid-wicket
Parnell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slanting into the hips, Iyer tucks it gently towards mid-wicket
Parnell to Shreyas Iyer, no run, back of a length around off, Iyer stays in the crease and punches it to mid-off
Nortje to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short of a length outside off, Iyer steers it away down to third man
Nortje to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, short ball, Iyer shuffles inside the line and pulls it away to the left of fine leg. Better running this time and they get a brce

Nortje to Samson, 1 run, deft from Samson! Used all of Nortje's pace for a lovely late dab. Wasn't all that short but he just got deep in the crease and steered it away. Third man got across with a terrific slide to save the boundary and strangely, only a single taken. Maybe the batters were so sure of the boundary
Nortje to Samson, no run, full and angled in on leg stump, Samson tucks it gently to mid-wicket
Nortje to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Iyer gets across and drives it fluently through the covers
Nortje to Samson, 1 run, short and wide, Samson stands tall and cuts it away past backward point
Rabada to Samson, 1 run, back of a length around off, Samson dabs it away down to third man

Rabada to Samson, SIX, Samson joins in the fun now! He smartly played it safe till Shreyas Iyer got his century and with the target also in sight now, decides to open up. Cracking shot too! Was fractionally short, he just stood tall and muscled the pull over wide long-on. Towering blow!
Rabada to Samson, no run, slanting in around off, Samson gets across a touch and defends
Rabada to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slanting into the pads, Iyer tickles it down to fine leg

Rabada to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, makes the Free Hit count, gets to his 2nd ODI ton! Knew the short ball is coming, backed away early and slapped it away over extra cover. Not the ideal connection but with the field up, he played the percentages well there. A fine knock from Iyer, his ODI form has always been very good and he continues to impress in the 50-over format
Rabada to Shreyas Iyer, no ball, slower and fuller outside off, Iyer defends with soft hands. Now then, Rabada has overstepped an and Iyer can't ask for a better way to get to 100
Rabada to Samson, 1 run, in-angler around off, Samson defends with soft hands towards cover and Shreyas Iyer wants the single. Easily done
Maharaj to Samson, 1 run, full and flat, Samson bunts it past cover
Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, speared into the pads, Iyer nurdles it away through square leg

Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, cut away! Just a tad short and that's enough for Iyer who sits deep in his crease and late cuts this away. Short third man could have perhaps done better, but it was struck well too
Maharaj to Shreyas Iyer, no run, quicker one around middle, cramps Iyer on the back foot as he misses the flick

Maharaj to Samson, 1 run, sloppy, sloppy stuff! Wayward throw at the keeper's end and it's well over the leaping de Kock. Rabada isn't backing up and they concede a single. Samson stepped out for the inside out but was fired flat and full by Maharaj, dug out to cover. Should have been a dot. Instead it's a single
Maharaj to Samson, no run, drifting in from around off, Samson defends gently to the off-side

Rabada to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, shortish, leg-lined, Iyer gets inside the line and plays a stylish half-pull. Once agai as it has been all through this evening, the timing is fab. Malan from deep square leg did well moving to his left, sliding well and has saved a brace for his side
Rabada to Samson, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Samson glides it away down to third man
Rabada to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short ball, but no venom or height on this, Iyer stands tall and pulls it away nicely to the left of deep square leg
Rabada to Samson, 1 run, slanting in from a good length, Samson stays in the crease and plays this with an angled bat, steering it down to third man
Rabada to Samson, no run, in-angler around off, Samson watchfully blocks off the front foot
Rabada to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full and outside off, Iyer presses half-forward and eases this through the covers

Fortuin to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by R Hendricks!! Oh dear! Ishan Kishan cannot believe it. He is down on his haunches and does not want to leave. Gotta feel for him as he played a superb knock. Perhaps the best in his brief international career. Looked set for a maiden hundred on his home ground and opportunities like these don't come too often. He played the pull so well today and got plenty of sixes playing that shot, but not this time. He was quick to latch onto the short ball but doesn't quite time it as well as he would have liked, drags it off the thick inside half and Reeza Hendricks takes a well-judged tumbling catch at deep mid-wicket. Parnell to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Parnell gets Dhawan again. Second time in two games. A big smile from Dhawan after the off-stump goes for a walk. Dhawan comes down the track and looks to play across the line to a good length on off, the body shape and balance are all awry and the off-stump goes for a spin. Parnell is delighted and South Africa have their first.  Dhawan b Parnell 13(20) [6s-1]

Parnell to Shubman Gill, no run, width outside off but skids through from a good length and keeps a fraction low, Shubman Gill cuts and misses

Fortuin to Dhawan, 1 run, just short of the forward-diving Reeza at deep mid-wicket. Dhawan comes down the track and flicks in the air, does not get hold of it, and gets lucky. Terrific effort from Reeza though to dive and get to it

Fortuin to Shubman Gill, 1 run, stump to stump line from Fortuin, driven back and he throws it back and hits the stumps at de Kock's end, the ball rolls away and the batters take a run. de Kock with a smile asks umpire Virender Sharma if it's a dead-ball or not, gets a smile in return

Siraj to Maharaj, out Bowled!! Maharaj's miserable stay at the crease ends in ultra-miserable fashion. Swung and missed quite a few, chewed up plenty of dot balls when he should have been giving Miller the strike, and now ensures that his partner won't be facing any more deliveries this innings. Went for an ugly heave, Siraj kept it simple, slow and straight, attacking the stumps. Maharaj missed, and saw the off stump ripped out. Maharaj b Siraj 5(13)

Thakur to Miller, FOUR, this is a sledgehammer blow! Shardul did well to get out of the way in time. Tried the yorker but Miller came charging, converted this into a low full toss and bashed it straight back past the bowler. Went to the fence in a jiffy

Was another play-and-a-miss from Maharaj, got beaten on the inside edge. Samson threw the ball back to Siraj who then had an angry throw at the non-striker's stumps. Don't think he was trying for a run out there, was more of a frustration there but the throw misses big time and mid-on had no chance. Overthrows given. India are unhappy because they thought the ball was dead. But it's the umpire's job to decide that and they felt it was live

Siraj to Maharaj, no run, play and a miss! This innings has hit a complete roadblock in the last 30 minutes. Slower ball outside off, Maharaj makes room and is beaten on the cut
Thakur to Miller, no run, slower and shorter, doesn't bounce at all and Miller misses the pull completely. Cops a blow near the midriff

Thakur to Miller, no run, didn't seem to be much going for this appeal, but Samson urged his skipper for a punt, and it's not worked. Slower ball on a length outside off, Miller was beaten on the drive and this just sneaked past the inside edge through to Samson. Never seem like an inside edge, but you can understand why India gambled with the review. Miller's wicket here is of massive significance to the final score

Went fuller a touch as well, inviting the big hit but Parnell could only slice this down to long-off. Iyer didn't have to budge one bit. India are pulling things back superbly in these final 10 overs. Parnell c Shreyas Iyer b Thakur 16(22)
